title: Daily Market Digest: February 25, 2026
subtitle: Market sentiment cautiously optimistic ahead of key earnings.

items.headline: U.S. Futures Edge Up as Investors Await Nvidia Earnings; AI Optimism Resurfaces
items.summary: U.S. stock futures climbed early Wednesday, reflecting a cautiously optimistic market sentiment as investors geared up for several major earnings reports, most notably AI leader Nvidia ($NVDA) after the bell. This pre-market rise follows Tuesday's broad gains across major indices, with a renewed focus on technology stocks as AI optimism resurfaced after recent fears of disruption.

items.headline: S&P 500 Performance
items.statContext: Up 0.20% today, following a 0.77% gain on Tuesday.
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.20% to 6904 points today, extending gains from Tuesday when it climbed 0.77%. S&P 500 futures were up 0.12% in early Wednesday trading.

items.headline: NASDAQ Performance
items.statContext: Futures up 0.17% today, gained 1.04% on Tuesday.
items.summary: NASDAQ Composite futures were up 0.17% early Wednesday. On Tuesday, the Nasdaq Composite gained 1.04%.

items.headline: Dow Jones Performance
items.statContext: Futures up 0.10% today, rose 0.76% on Tuesday.
items.summary: Dow Jones Industrial Average futures were up 0.10% early Wednesday. The DJIA rose 0.76% on Tuesday.

items.headline: Axon Enterprise Soars on Strong Outlook
items.summary: Axon Enterprise shares jumped 16% after the Taser and body-camera maker surpassed quarterly expectations and projected robust 2026 revenue growth of 27%â€“30%. The company also set ambitious 2028 targets, citing rising demand across hardware, software, and AI-driven products.

items.headline: CAVA Group Advances on Upbeat Guidance
items.summary: CAVA Group shares advanced 9% after the company topped Wall Street estimates and issued upbeat guidance for fiscal year 2026.

items.headline: AMD Surges on Meta Platforms Deal
items.summary: Advanced Micro Devices ($AMD) gained 8.8% on Tuesday following the announcement of a multiyear, 6 gigawatt deal to supply computing capacity to Meta Platforms.

items.headline: Salesforce Down Amid AI Disruption Fears
items.summary: Salesforce ($CRM) has seen its shares drop 30% year-to-date amid concerns that new AI tools will disrupt software businesses. The company is scheduled to report its Q4 2026 earnings today.

items.headline: Intuit Slumps on AI Concerns
items.summary: Intuit shares have slumped approximately 46% year-to-date due to anxieties surrounding AI disruption in the software industry. The company is set to report its earnings on Thursday.

items.headline: Copart Shares Decline on Slow Volume Growth
items.summary: Copart, Inc. ($CPRT) experienced a 13.15% decline over the past month and a 37.30% loss over 52 weeks, attributed to slower volume growth resulting from changes in auto insurance market dynamics.

items.headline: Nvidia Earnings Eyed as Key Market Driver
items.summary: All eyes are on chip giant Nvidia ($NVDA) as it prepares to release its Q4 2026 results after the market closes today. Analysts view Nvidia's earnings as a crucial bellwether for AI enthusiasm and the overall tech sector's mood, given the company's dominant role in artificial intelligence.

items.headline: Market Leadership Shifts Away from Tech and Financials
items.summary: Recent weeks have witnessed a clear shift in market leadership, with technology and financial stocks losing their edge. Sectors that typically perform well in the later stages of the business cycle, such as Energy and Consumer Staples, are gaining prominence. The S&P 500 software and services index is notably down 23% year-to-date.

items.headline: Strong Hiring Figures, Fed Holds Rates Steady
items.summary: Fresh figures from ADP reveal that private employers added approximately 12,750 jobs per week over the past month, marking the fastest pace since late November. Meanwhile, the Federal Reserve maintained interest rates in January and is anticipated to implement one or two rate cuts in 2026. However, some Fed officials have considered a potential rate hike if inflation persists above target.

items.headline: Trump Reasserts Tariff Stance Following Supreme Court Ruling
items.summary: During his State of the Union address on Tuesday, President Trump reaffirmed his commitment to tariffs, vowing to replace those recently deemed illegal by the Supreme Court. He announced a new 10% tax on most imports into the U.S., asserting that congressional action would not be necessary and that tariffs would 'substantially replace the modern-day system of income tax.'

items.headline: Mortgage Rates Decline; Housing Market Challenges Remain
items.summary: National mortgage rates were mostly lower this week, with the 30-year fixed rate decreasing by 0.15% to 6.04%. Despite the lower rates, high home prices, a stagnant job market, and economic uncertainty continue to deter potential homebuyers. The Federal Reserve is expected to maintain its benchmark rate at the upcoming March meeting.
